benchmark_details.name: Magic Mushroom: A Customizable Benchmark for Fine-grained Analysis of Retrieval Noise Erosion in RAG Systems
benchmark_details.overview: Magic Mushroom is a benchmark designed to evaluate the robustness of Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) systems under complex retrieval noise, enabling flexible configurations of noise types and proportions.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate LLM robustness under complex retrieval noise and facilitate the development of noise-robust RAG systems.

data.source: Built on Natural Questions and HotpotQA datasets.
data.annotation: Documents were manually verified for factual and structural integrity.

methodology.calculation: Correctness is scored by comparing generated answers to gold answers.
methodology.interpretation: Higher correctness scores indicate better model performance in noise conditions.
methodology.baseline_results: Various baseline models tested include Llama-3.1 8B and Qwen-2.5 1.5B.
methodology.validation: Results averaged over independent runs to ensure statistical reliability.
